data.text: Need a Small Lightweight Camping Chair for Bikepacking
Hi folks, Im thinking of buying a camping chair for my bikepacking adventures....can anybody recommend a small lightweight one please?
Helinox Zero - ultra lightweight and comfortable!

data.author: Bree Pitcock

data.text: Helinox, unbeatable. If you go for a copy, check the difference in weight before handing over any money. A lot of them are considerably heavier (and none I've seen match Helinox's quality, either).
data.author: Phil Metcalfe

data.text: Helinox

data.text: same. 450 gram (1lbs).
data.author: Adir Sharon

data.text:
I recently bought this one. Took it on my tour through France. For me it is more comfortable (also stable) and cheaper than the Helinox Zero, a bit higher above the ground and with its plastic balls at the feet the chair doesn't sink into the ground, even if it is sand......bit heavier than the Helinox Zero though, it weighs 800g. About half the price, until now I can't say anything negative about the quality. https://www.naturehike.com/collections/chair-table-bed/products/naturehike-outdoor-ultralight-aluminium-portable-foldable-chair?variant=39803839774902
YL08 Ultralight Foldable Camping Chair
naturehike.com

data.text: The lightest an most packable would be the chair sleeve for the sleeping matt your already carring.. thermarest puts one out.. nice.. and adjust the lean back.. but your on the ground ..
